cards.name: Afterlife
cards.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller puts a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Its mortar is mixed with waters straight from the Fountain of Cho.
cards.name: Alabaster Wall
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.flavor:
We all must profit for peace to last.
—Mercadian saying
cards.name: Armistice
cards.text: {3}{W}{W}: You draw a card and target opponent gains 3 life.

cards.flavor: Orim had no memory of the previous night—the first thing she could remember was waking up with the dead guard's blood on her hands.
cards.name: Arrest
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.

cards.flavor: The perfect antidote for a tightly packed formation.
cards.name: Ballista Squad
cards.text: {X}{W}, {T}: Ballista Squad deals X damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.name: Charm Peddler
cards.text: {W}, {T}, Discard a card: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.flavor: Are you sure you can afford such a luxury?
cards.name: Charmed Griffin
cards.text:
Flying
When Charmed Griffin enters the battlefield, each other player may put an artifact or enchantment card onto the battlefield from his or her hand.

cards.name: Cho-Arrim Alchemist
cards.text: {1}{W}{W}, {T}, Discard a card: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

cards.flavor: He doesn't know why the Cho-Arrim fight the Mercadians, but he's happy to bash heads for them anyway.
cards.name: Cho-Arrim Bruiser
cards.text: Whenever Cho-Arrim Bruiser attacks, you may tap up to two target creatures.

cards.name: Cho-Arrim Legate
cards.text:
Protection from black
If an opponent controls a Swamp and you control a Plains, you may cast Cho-Arrim Legate without paying its mana cost.

cards.flavor:
"Mercadia's masks can no longer hide the truth. Our day has come at last."
—Cho-Manno
cards.name: Cho-Manno, Revolutionary
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Cho-Manno, Revolutionary.

cards.name: Cho-Manno's Blessing
cards.text:
Flash
Enchant creature
As Cho-Manno's Blessing enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Enchanted creature has protection from the chosen color. This effect doesn't remove Cho-Manno's Blessing.

cards.flavor: Mercadia City's troops are at their best when they have no enemy to fight.
cards.name: Common Cause
cards.text: Nonartifact creatures get +2/+2 as long as they all share a color.

cards.flavor:
Don't step on the livelihood of other vendors, or they may step on you.
—Mercadian saying
cards.name: Cornered Market
cards.text:
Players can't cast spells with the same name as a nontoken permanent.
Players can't play nonbasic lands with the same name as a nontoken permanent.

cards.flavor:
"There is no place for mercy in defense of our lives."
—Ta-Spon, Cho-Arrim executioner
cards.name: Crackdown
cards.text: Nonwhite creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

cards.flavor: The crossbow is the ideal weapon for the lazy Mercadians: just point and shoot.
cards.name: Crossbow Infantry
cards.text: {T}: Crossbow Infantry deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.flavor: The Cho-Arrim fought Mercadia's decadence with more than just swords.
cards.name: Devout Witness
cards.text: {1}{W}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.flavor:
The scepter of power is fragile in a calloused hand.
—Cho-Arrim saying
cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.flavor: The Cho-Arrim didn't rely only on a secret location to protect their Fountain.
cards.name: Fountain Watch
cards.text: Artifacts and enchantments you control have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)

cards.flavor: Every Cho-Arrim villager is a potential warrior; when they are called, they abandon their peaceful way of life and take up arms to defend it.
cards.name: Fresh Volunteers

cards.flavor:
"May the River claim Cho-Manno's body, wherever it lies."
—Ta-Karnst, Cho-Arrim healer
cards.name: Honor the Fallen
cards.text: Exile all creature cards from all graveyards. You gain 1 life for each card exiled this way.

cards.flavor: Cowardice is a term invented by those with no cunning.
cards.name: Ignoble Soldier
cards.text: Whenever Ignoble Soldier becomes blocked, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by it this turn.

cards.flavor: A soldier's faith is magic strong enough to protect against any blade.
cards.name: Inviolability
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature.

cards.flavor: "I did not choose my role, Orim," said Cho-Manno patiently, "and I suspect Gerrard did not choose his."
cards.name: Ivory Mask
cards.text: You have shroud. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.flavor: War-trained jhovalls eat twice their weight in war-trained soldiers daily.
cards.name: Jhovall Queen
cards.text: Vigilance

cards.flavor: Don't be fooled by the riders' fluid grace—it takes years of practice to ride these beasts.
cards.name: Jhovall Rider
cards.text: Trample

cards.flavor: "The River flows. My soul returns."
cards.name: Last Breath
cards.text: Exile target creature with power 2 or less. Its controller gains 4 life.

cards.flavor: The silence commemorates not those who've died, but those about to.
cards.name: Moment of Silence
cards.text: Target player skips his or her next combat phase this turn.

cards.flavor:
"As long as Rushwood glows, no life is ever truly lost."
—Ta-Karnst, Cho-Arrim healer
cards.name: Moonlit Wake
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, you gain 1 life.

cards.flavor:
Clenched teeth do not bite.
—Cho-Arrim saying
cards.name: Muzzle
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all damage that would be dealt by enchanted creature.

cards.flavor: Once you learn to float on the shadows, you'll never fear them again.
cards.name: Nightwind Glider
cards.text: Flying, protection from black

cards.flavor: Fighting for the right reason is itself a source of strength.
cards.name: Noble Purpose
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage, you gain that much life.

cards.name: Orim's Cure
cards.text:
If you control a Plains, you may tap an untapped creature you control rather than pay Orim's Cure's mana cost.
Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.flavor: The Cho-Arrim make no distinction between healers and soldiers.
cards.name: Pious Warrior
cards.text: Whenever Pious Warrior is dealt combat damage, you gain that much life.

cards.flavor: The Cho-Arrim believe in leading by example.
cards.name: Ramosian Captain
cards.text:
First strike
{5}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 4 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: "Cho-Manno guides your spirit. I guide your sword."
cards.name: Ramosian Commander
cards.text: {6}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 5 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: "Give me your hand and I will give you victory."
cards.name: Ramosian Lieutenant
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Ramosian Rally
cards.text:
If you control a Plains, you may tap an untapped creature you control rather than pay Ramosian Rally's mana cost.
Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Her commands are part rallying cry, part sermon, and wholly undeniable.
cards.name: Ramosian Sergeant
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 2 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: The Cho-Arrim fell from the sky onto Mercadia City like a vengeful rain.
cards.name: Ramosian Sky Marshal
cards.text:
Flying
{7}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 6 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Rappelling Scouts
cards.text:
Flying
{2}{W}: Rappelling Scouts gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Gerrard offered no defense to Orim's condemnation; the mission was under his command, and he was responsible.
cards.name: Renounce
cards.text: Sacrifice any number of permanents. You gain 2 life for each permanent sacrificed this way.

cards.flavor: The Cho-Arrim worship life and revere those who've experienced it longest.
cards.name: Revered Elder
cards.text: {1}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Revered Elder this turn.

cards.name: Reverent Mantra
cards.text:
You may exile a white card from your hand rather than pay Reverent Mantra's mana cost.
Choose a color. All creatures gain protection from the chosen color until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"There is a great difference between pain and injury."
—Cho-Manno
cards.name: Righteous Aura
cards.text: {W}, Pay 2 life: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.flavor: "You are the disease that plagues Mercadia. I am the healer's knife that will cut you out."
cards.name: Righteous Indignation
cards.text: Whenever a creature blocks a black or red creature, the blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Security Detail
cards.text: {W}{W}: Put a 1/1 white Soldier creature token onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only if you control no creatures and only once each turn.

cards.flavor: Orim taught Ta-Karnst and the other Cho-Arrim healers a far less invasive method of healing.
cards.name: Soothing Balm
cards.text: Target player gains 5 life.

cards.name: Spiritual Focus
cards.text: Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard a card, you gain 2 life and you may draw a card.

cards.flavor: The Mercadians were prepared for the guard, but the guard was even more prepared for the Mercadians.
cards.name: Steadfast Guard
cards.text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

cards.name: Story Circle
cards.text:
As Story Circle enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{W}: The next time a source of your choice of the chosen color would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.flavor: They are the reflection of Rushwood's glow on the edge of a wooden sword.
cards.name: Task Force
cards.text: Whenever Task Force becomes the target of a spell or ability, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"The Mercadians are too busy looking down on us to see us coming."
—Cho-Arrim rebel
cards.name: Thermal Glider
cards.text: Flying, protection from red

cards.flavor: "The price is written at the bottom of the cup."
cards.name: Tonic Peddler
cards.text: {W}, {T}, Discard a card: Target player gains 3 life.

cards.flavor: "How could I catch her when the trees conspired to stop me?"
cards.name: Trap Runner
cards.text: {T}: Target unblocked attacking creature becomes blocked. Activate this ability only during combat after blockers are declared. (This ability works on creatures that can't be blocked.)

cards.flavor: Inner conflict can defeat a soldier more quickly than any army.
cards.name: Wave of Reckoning
cards.text: Each creature deals damage to itself equal to its power.

cards.flavor: "It's not what you ask for, but how you ask for it."
cards.name: Wishmonger
cards.text: {2}: Target creature gains protection from the color of its controller's choice until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.

cards.flavor: Successful delivery is not guaranteed.
cards.name: Aerial Caravan
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{U}{U}: Exile the top card of your library. Until end of turn, you may play that card. (Reveal the card as you exile it.)

cards.flavor: The market festival turned out to be the high point of Jaffy's visit.
cards.name: Balloon Peddler
cards.text: {U}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "I need to get back to Mercadia City," said Sisay. "We can get you there," the vizier answered. "Easily."
cards.name: Blockade Runner
cards.text: {U}: Blockade Runner can't be blocked this turn.

cards.flavor:
"I see more than others do because I know where to look."
—Saprazzan vizier
cards.name: Brainstorm
cards.text: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.

cards.flavor: In Mercadia City, loyalties extend only as far as your purse can stretch.
cards.name: Bribery
cards.text: Search target opponent's library for a creature card and put that card onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.flavor: Saprazzan merfolk become legged on land, but some find it quicker to bring the water with them.
cards.name: Buoyancy
cards.text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.

cards.flavor: What's merely a home for the nautilus can become exquisite jewelry in the hands of Saprazzan artisans.
cards.name: Chambered Nautilus
cards.text: Whenever Chambered Nautilus becomes blocked, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Chameleon Spirit
cards.text:
As Chameleon Spirit enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Chameleon Spirit's power and toughness are each equal to the number of permanents of the chosen color your opponents control.

cards.flavor: It was Gerrard's nature to lead and the Mercadians' to follow.
cards.name: Charisma
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to a creature, gain control of the other creature for as long as Charisma remains on the battlefield.

cards.flavor: The delicate sprites carry messages for Saprazzans, but they refuse to land in Mercadia City's filthy markets.
cards.name: Cloud Sprite
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Cloud Sprite can block only creatures with flying.

cards.flavor: "I don't like to think of myself as a pirate. I'm more like a stimulator of the local economy."
cards.name: Coastal Piracy
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"Your attack has been rendered harmless. It is, however, quite pretty."
—Saprazzan vizier
cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.

cards.flavor: Gerrard was the Mercadian soldiers' greatest hero; they followed him blindly. When he left, they stumbled around blindly.
cards.name: Cowardice
cards.text: Whenever a creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, return that creature to its owner's hand. (It won't be affected by the spell or ability.)

cards.flavor: A bribe is always faster than filling out paperwork.
cards.name: Customs Depot
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.flavor: You might as well try to catch water with a net.
cards.name: Darting Merfolk
cards.text: {U}: Return Darting Merfolk to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor:
"You say Saprazzo is a city built on water? I hope they have enough to wash the dust from my throat."
—Sisay
cards.name: Dehydration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.name: Diplomatic Escort
cards.text: {U}, {T}, Discard a card: Counter target spell or ability that targets a creature.

cards.name: Diplomatic Immunity
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Shroud (A permanent with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Enchanted creature has shroud.

cards.flavor: There is beauty in the space between learning to fly and taking it for granted.
cards.name: Drake Hatchling
cards.text:
Flying
{U}: Drake Hatchling gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Embargo
cards.text:
Nonland permanents don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life.

cards.flavor: Karn said nothing—he just grasped the powerstone and squeezed tightly. The wild flashing ceased.
cards.name: Energy Flux
cards.text: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."

cards.flavor: The fewer your possessions, the fewer your worries.
cards.name: Extravagant Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Extravagant Spirit unless you pay {1} for each card in your hand.

cards.flavor: "Go down there and fish him out. Maybe his hide will fetch a price."
cards.name: False Demise
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to the battlefield under your control.

cards.flavor: Beautiful to behold, terrible to be held.
cards.name: Glowing Anemone
cards.text: When Glowing Anemone enters the battlefield, you may return target land to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: Don't trust your secrets to the sea.
cards.name: Gush
cards.text:
You may return two Islands you control to their owner's hand rather than pay Gush's mana cost.
Draw two cards.

cards.flavor:
Bend as the wave breaks or it will break you as well.
—Saprazzan saying
cards.name: High Seas
cards.text: Red creature spells and green creature spells cost {1} more to cast.

cards.flavor: The youths of Rishada's marketplace are always ready for a quick footrace.
cards.name: Hoodwink
cards.text: Return target artifact, enchantment, or land to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: It's not always clear who's the master and who's the servant.
cards.name: Indentured Djinn
cards.text:
Flying
When Indentured Djinn enters the battlefield, each other player may draw up to three cards.

cards.name: Karn's Touch
cards.text: Target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost until end of turn. (It retains its abilities.)

cards.name: Misdirection
cards.text:
You may exile a blue card from your hand rather than pay Misdirection's mana cost.
Change the target of target spell with a single target.

cards.flavor:
The feet have no eyes.
—Saprazzan saying
cards.name: Misstep
cards.text: Creatures target player controls don't untap during that player's next untap step.

cards.flavor: "It's no challenge to master a Mercadian."
cards.name: Overtaker
cards.text: {3}{U}, {T}, Discard a card: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "There may be a few minor additional fees, levies, duties, surtaxes, tariffs, imposts, tolls . . . ."
cards.name: Port Inspector
cards.text: Whenever Port Inspector becomes blocked, you may look at defending player's hand.

cards.flavor: The view is truly spectacular—as long as you don't look at Rishada itself.
cards.name: Rishadan Airship
cards.text:
Flying
Rishadan Airship can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Rishadan Brigand
cards.text:
Flying
When Rishadan Brigand enters the battlefield, each opponent sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {3}.
Rishadan Brigand can block only creatures with flying.

cards.flavor:
The bigger the purse, the greater the fool.
—Rishadan saying
cards.name: Rishadan Cutpurse
cards.text: When Rishadan Cutpurse enters the battlefield, each opponent sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {1}.

cards.flavor: "The best things in life are free. Money, for instance."
cards.name: Rishadan Footpad
cards.text: When Rishadan Footpad enters the battlefield, each opponent sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {2}.

cards.flavor: Clients who cheat the sailmonger make an impact on the rest.
cards.name: Sailmonger
cards.text: {2}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.

cards.name: Sand Squid
cards.text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
You may choose not to untap Sand Squid during your untap step.
{T}: Tap target creature. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Sand Squid remains tapped.

cards.name: Saprazzan Bailiff
cards.text:
When Saprazzan Bailiff enters the battlefield, exile all artifact and enchantment cards from all graveyards.
When Saprazzan Bailiff leaves the battlefield, return all artifact and enchantment cards from all graveyards to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Saprazzan Breaker
cards.text: {U}: Put the top card of your library into your graveyard. If that card is a land card, Saprazzan Breaker can't be blocked this turn.

cards.flavor: Within the walls of the floating city, Saprazzan wealth is like Saprazzan water: abundant, free-flowing, and accessible to all.
cards.name: Saprazzan Heir
cards.text: Whenever Saprazzan Heir becomes blocked, you may draw three cards.

cards.name: Saprazzan Legate
cards.text:
Flying
If an opponent controls a Mountain and you control an Island, you may cast Saprazzan Legate without paying its mana cost.

cards.flavor: The Saprazzans excel at both tactics: hit and run.
cards.name: Saprazzan Outrigger
cards.text: When Saprazzan Outrigger attacks or blocks, put it on top of its owner's library at end of combat.

cards.flavor: Some quick dagger work and then back to the sea—that's the Saprazzan way.
cards.name: Saprazzan Raider
cards.text: When Saprazzan Raider becomes blocked, return it to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: Rishadan barkeeps know something the Mercadians have yet to learn: if you keep pushing, someone will eventually push back.
cards.name: Shoving Match
cards.text: Until end of turn, all creatures gain "{T}: Tap target creature."

cards.flavor: The vizier's wisdom proved invaluable in untangling the Mercadian knot of lies.
cards.name: Soothsaying
cards.text:
{3}{U}{U}: Shuffle your library.
{X}: Look at the top X cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

cards.flavor: Any pirate would prefer Rishada's swift and cruel justice to Saprazzo's patient punishments.
cards.name: Squeeze
cards.text: Sorcery spells cost {3} more to cast.

cards.flavor:
"Inside these walls, peace; outside, sharks. You choose."
—Saprazzan vizier
cards.name: Statecraft
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by creatures you control.

cards.name: Stinging Barrier
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{U}, {T}: Stinging Barrier deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Thwart
cards.text:
You may return three Islands you control to their owner's hand rather than pay Thwart's mana cost.
Counter target spell.

cards.flavor: The dry riverbed became a raging torrent, and the Cho-Arrim claimed their prize.
cards.name: Tidal Bore
cards.text:
You may return an Island you control to its owner's hand rather than pay Tidal Bore's mana cost.
You may tap or untap target creature.

cards.flavor: To merfolk, pirates are a nuisance. To pirates, merfolk are a threat. To the kraken, they're both appetizers.
cards.name: Tidal Kraken
cards.text: Tidal Kraken can't be blocked.

cards.flavor: It flees from anything that isn't shaped like a cloud.
cards.name: Timid Drake
cards.text:
Flying
When another creature enters the battlefield, return Timid Drake to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: Like the price of goods, the value of the routes was renegotiated daily.
cards.name: Trade Routes
cards.text:
{1}: Return target land you control to its owner's hand.
{1}, Discard a land card: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: The worst thing about being a depraved pirate is having to work with a bunch of depraved pirates.
cards.name: War Tax
cards.text: {X}{U}: This turn, creatures can't attack unless their controller pays {X} for each attacking creature he or she controls.

cards.flavor: Closing time comes earlier to some than to others.
cards.name: Waterfront Bouncer
cards.text: {U}, {T}, Discard a card: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: One distracts the victim, the other extracts the valuables.
cards.name: Alley Grifters
cards.text: Whenever Alley Grifters becomes blocked, defending player discards a card.

cards.name: Black Market
cards.text:
Whenever a creature dies, put a charge counter on Black Market.
At the beginning of your precombat main phase, add {B} to your mana pool for each charge counter on Black Market.

cards.flavor: They slide over the bog like oil across glass.
cards.name: Bog Smugglers
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

cards.flavor: The world is the body. The mana is the blood. The witch is the surgeon.
cards.name: Bog Witch
cards.text: {B}, {T}, Discard a card: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: The touch of his madness can drive anyone into a killing frenzy.
cards.name: Cackling Witch
cards.text: {X}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The Cateran guild prefers to call them "public relations."
cards.name: Cateran Brute
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 2 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Cateran Enforcer
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
{4}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 4 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Recruits aren't always volunteers.
cards.name: Cateran Kidnappers
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Cateran Overlord
cards.text:
Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Cateran Overlord.
{6}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 6 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Cateran Persuader
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 1 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Cateran Slaver
cards.text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
{5}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 5 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Even when recruitment is slow, the guild can always cook something up.
cards.name: Cateran Summons
cards.text: Search your library for a Mercenary card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Conspiracy
cards.text:
As Conspiracy enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Creature cards you own that aren't on the battlefield, creature spells you control, and creatures you control are the chosen type.

cards.flavor: His favor comes at a high price.
cards.name: Corrupt Official
cards.text:
{2}{B}: Regenerate Corrupt Official.
Whenever Corrupt Official becomes blocked, defending player discards a card at random.

cards.flavor:
"Eye of twilight, give us sight.
Take our offer, give us might.
Make our power tears of night."
cards.name: Dark Ritual
cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Deathgazer
cards.text: Whenever Deathgazer blocks or becomes blocked by a nonblack creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

cards.flavor: They feed on the living to stay undead.
cards.name: Deepwood Ghoul
cards.text: Pay 2 life: Regenerate Deepwood Ghoul.

cards.name: Deepwood Legate
cards.text:
If an opponent controls a Forest and you control a Swamp, you may cast Deepwood Legate without paying its mana cost.
{B}: Deepwood Legate gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: It wears the souls of its victims like jewels on a chain.
cards.name: Delraich
cards.text:
Trample
You may sacrifice three black creatures rather than pay Delraich's mana cost.

cards.name: Enslaved Horror
cards.text: When Enslaved Horror enters the battlefield, each other player may return a creature card from his or her graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.flavor: The enforcers make no effort to distinguish gold from flesh.
cards.name: Extortion
cards.text: Look at target player's hand and choose up to two cards from it. That player discards those cards.

cards.flavor: The Caterans call it a screening process. The dead are in no condition to argue.
cards.name: Forced March
cards.text: Destroy all creatures with converted mana cost X or less.

cards.flavor: Mercadians not wealthy enough to buy a tomb are thrown into a bog called "the Ghoul's Larder."
cards.name: Ghoul's Feast
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: It seemed as if no one wanted them to reach the Henge of Ramos—not even the dead.
cards.name: Haunted Crossroads
cards.text: {B}: Put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.

cards.flavor: "Tonight, madam, it's your money and your life."
cards.name: Highway Robber
cards.text: When Highway Robber enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

cards.flavor: The desecration of their dead makes even the Saprazzans careless.
cards.name: Instigator
cards.text: {1}{B}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Creatures target player controls attack this turn if able.

cards.name: Insubordination
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the end step of enchanted creature's controller, Insubordination deals 2 damage to that player unless that creature attacked this turn.

cards.flavor: "If they move, kill them. In fact, kill one now to make sure the other understands."
cards.name: Intimidation
cards.text: Creatures you control have fear. (They can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

cards.name: Larceny
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.

cards.flavor: Gerrard realized that the helpless woman they'd rescued from Rath was nothing of the sort.
cards.name: Liability
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken permanent is put into a player's graveyard from the battlefield, that player loses 1 life.

cards.flavor:
"If this is the cure, I'd hate to see the disease."
—Orim
cards.name: Maggot Therapy
cards.text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/-2.

cards.flavor: Bury old friends deeply, lest they return bearing worms.
cards.name: Midnight Ritual
cards.text: Exile X target creature cards from your graveyard. For each creature card exiled this way, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: You'd scarcely believe they could fly until they drop out of the sky onto you.
cards.name: Misshapen Fiend
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: Shed harpy feathers leave painful wounds—which explains the harpies' mood.
cards.name: Molting Harpy
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Molting Harpy unless you pay {2}.

cards.flavor: It roams in both the worlds of the living and the dead but belongs to neither.
cards.name: Nether Spirit
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if Nether Spirit is the only creature card in your graveyard, you may return Nether Spirit to the battlefield.

cards.flavor: He wears his infamy like a fine silk shirt.
cards.name: Notorious Assassin
cards.text: {2}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor: The surest way to lose your holdings is to plead for them in Mercadia City's courts.
cards.name: Pretender's Claim
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature becomes blocked, tap all lands defending player controls.

cards.flavor: His mind, like his body, is made up of the swamp's flotsam.
cards.name: Primeval Shambler
cards.text: {B}: Primeval Shambler gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Do you want to be alive or whole?"
—Ta-Karnst, Cho-Arrim healer
cards.name: Putrefaction
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a green or white spell, that player discards a card.

cards.name: Quagmire Lamprey
cards.text: Whenever Quagmire Lamprey becomes blocked by a creature, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.

cards.flavor: Mercadian elitism is reinforced daily by physical position: their neighbors are literally beneath them and are treated accordingly.
cards.name: Rain of Tears
cards.text: Destroy target land.

cards.flavor:
"Not even the magistrate in his lofty tower is out of our reach."
—Cateran overlord
cards.name: Rampart Crawler
cards.text: Rampart Crawler can't be blocked by Walls.

cards.name: Rouse
cards.text:
If you control a Swamp, you may pay 2 life rather than pay Rouse's mana cost.
Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Silence costs extra. Breaking it costs extra still.
cards.name: Scandalmonger
cards.text: {2}: Target player discards a card. Any player may activate this ability but only any time he or she could cast a sorcery.

cards.flavor:
"With the proper tools, even the Great River can be dammed."
—Ta-Spon, Cho-Arrim executioner
cards.name: Sever Soul
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. You gain life equal to its toughness.

cards.flavor: She feels no need to disturb her victim's slumber.
cards.name: Silent Assassin
cards.text: {3}{B}: Destroy target blocking creature at end of combat.

cards.flavor: In the Cateran guild, being caught is a capital offense.
cards.name: Skulking Fugitive
cards.text: When Skulking Fugitive becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.

cards.flavor: Squee watched his Kyren cousins fall with a mixture of sympathy and relief.
cards.name: Snuff Out
cards.text:
If you control a Swamp, you may pay 4 life rather than pay Snuff Out's mana cost.
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor: Driven by masters more terrible than the Mercadians could imagine, the dark overseers would pay any price to keep their shipwrights working.
cards.name: Soul Channeling
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Pay 2 life: Regenerate enchanted creature.

cards.flavor: As he gritted his teeth to focus through the pain, Tahngarth glanced at Takara. She seemed completely unaffected.
cards.name: Specter's Wail
cards.text: Target player discards a card at random.

cards.flavor: "No, I insist—let me carry all that heavy jewelry."
cards.name: Strongarm Thug
cards.text: When Strongarm Thug enters the battlefield, you may return target Mercenary card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Young wumpuses are malevolent and vicious—but they grow out of it.
cards.name: Thrashing Wumpus
cards.text: {B}: Thrashing Wumpus deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.flavor: The weight of death is heavy but not immovable.
cards.name: Undertaker
cards.text: {B}, {T}, Discard a card: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Unmask
cards.text:
You may exile a black card from your hand rather than pay Unmask's mana cost.
Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Unnatural Hunger
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Unnatural Hunger deals damage to that player equal to that creature's power unless he or she sacrifices another creature.

cards.flavor: Starke knew the voice was Takara's, but the venom was Volrath's.
cards.name: Vendetta
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. You lose life equal to that creature's toughness.

cards.flavor: It reflects only nightmares.
cards.name: Wall of Distortion
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{2}{B}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

cards.flavor: He has the weapons, he has the connections, and he knows the hangar's dark secret.
cards.name: Arms Dealer
cards.text: {1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Arms Dealer deals 4 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Battle Rampart
cards.text:
Defender
{T}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The goblins made an unruly pile with military precision.
cards.name: Battle Squadron
cards.text:
Flying
Battle Squadron's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.

cards.flavor: "Don't get up. I'll show myself out."
cards.name: Blaster Mage
cards.text: {R}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy target Wall.

cards.name: Blood Hound
cards.text:
Whenever you're dealt damage, you may put that many +1/+1 counters on Blood Hound.
At the beginning of your end step, remove all +1/+1 counters from Blood Hound.

cards.name: Blood Oath
cards.text: Choose a card type. Target opponent reveals his or her hand. Blood Oath deals 3 damage to that player for each card of the chosen type revealed this way. (Artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal are card types.)

cards.flavor: Anything can happen when patience is scarce and wine is abundant.
cards.name: Brawl
cards.text: Until end of turn, all creatures gain "{T}: This creature deals damage equal to its power to target creature."

cards.name: Cave Sense
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has mountainwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

cards.flavor: One fleet was gone; others were poised.
cards.name: Cave-In
cards.text:
You may exile a red card from your hand rather than pay Cave-In's mana cost.
Cave-In deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Cavern Crawler
cards.text:
Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
{R}: Cavern Crawler gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"These guards are the most disciplined military unit in the city. They couldn't fight their way out of a broom closet, but they've got discipline."
—Gerrard, to Sisay
cards.name: Ceremonial Guard
cards.text: When Ceremonial Guard attacks or blocks, destroy it at end of combat.

cards.flavor: Their rage can grow to such proportions that they explode in a cloud of fire.
cards.name: Cinder Elemental
cards.text: {X}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Cinder Elemental: Cinder Elemental deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: The Mercadians' ineptitude in close combat sometimes accidentally pays off.
cards.name: Close Quarters
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control becomes blocked, Close Quarters deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: It follows the strongest leader—the one with the longest whip.
cards.name: Crag Saurian
cards.text: Whenever a source deals damage to Crag Saurian, that source's controller gains control of Crag Saurian.

cards.flavor: Gerrard shook his head as the ground rushed to meet him. "This," he thought, "is not the start I was hoping for."
cards.name: Crash
cards.text:
You may sacrifice a Mountain rather than pay Crash's mana cost.
Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Flailing Manticore
cards.text:
Flying, first strike
{1}: Flailing Manticore gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
{1}: Flailing Manticore gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.

cards.name: Flailing Ogre
cards.text:
{1}: Flailing Ogre gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
{1}: Flailing Ogre gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.

cards.name: Flailing Soldier
cards.text:
{1}: Flailing Soldier gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
{1}: Flailing Soldier gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.

cards.flavor:
"It's not Talruum crystal, but I must admit—it gets the job done."
—Tahngarth
cards.name: Flaming Sword
cards.text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has first strike.

cards.flavor:
"Does it burn, Saprazzan? Do you wish you had never raised arms against us?"
—Kyren overseer
cards.name: Furious Assault
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, Furious Assault deals 1 damage to target player.

cards.flavor: Had Gerrard realized he'd end up fighting against them, he might not have trained them so well.
cards.name: Gerrard's Irregulars
cards.text: Trample, haste

cards.flavor: When he's holding the hammers, everything looks like a nail.
cards.name: Hammer Mage
cards.text: {X}{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy all artifacts with converted mana cost X or less.

cards.name: Hired Giant
cards.text: When Hired Giant enters the battlefield, each other player may search his or her library for a land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then each player who searched his or her library this way shuffles it.

cards.flavor: Her blade draws blood without ever touching its target.
cards.name: Kris Mage
cards.text: {R}, {T}, Discard a card: Kris Mage deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: Mercadia's Kyren goblins are the opposite of Dominarian goblins: they're smart and cowardly.
cards.name: Kyren Glider
cards.text:
Flying
Kyren Glider can't block.

cards.name: Kyren Legate
cards.text:
Haste
If an opponent controls a Plains and you control a Mountain, you may cast Kyren Legate without paying its mana cost.

cards.flavor: Kyren goblins always speak in questions and never allow wrong answers.
cards.name: Kyren Negotiations
cards.text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Kyren Negotiations deals 1 damage to target player.

cards.flavor: Kyren goblins always act behind the scenes—even in battle.
cards.name: Kyren Sniper
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have Kyren Sniper deal 1 damage to target player.

cards.name: Lava Runner
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever Lava Runner becomes the target of a spell or ability, that spell or ability's controller sacrifices a land.

cards.flavor: Quick enough to avoid jhovalls when alone and fierce enough to attack them in packs, the hounds were as at home in the mountains as the Mercadians were atop theirs.
cards.name: Lightning Hounds
cards.text: First strike

cards.flavor: It's viciously territorial, destroying every creature on the mountain it has chosen to consume.
cards.name: Lithophage
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Lithophage unless you sacrifice a Mountain.

cards.flavor: Cho-Arrim righteousness was no match for Benalish combat training.
cards.name: Lunge
cards.text: Lunge deals 2 damage to target creature and 2 damage to target player.

cards.flavor: The magistrate had been the goblins' puppet for so long that he made the right decisions with little prompting.
cards.name: Magistrate's Veto
cards.text: White creatures and blue creatures can't block.

cards.flavor: With an explosion that shook the foundation of the city, the Weatherlight burst from the underground hangar.
cards.name: Mercadia's Downfall
cards.text: Each attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each nonbasic land defending player controls.

cards.flavor: He doesn't have to be smart—his masters only ever give him one command.
cards.name: Ogre Taskmaster
cards.text: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.

cards.name: Pulverize
cards.text:
You may sacrifice two Mountains rather than pay Pulverize's mana cost.
Destroy all artifacts.

cards.flavor:
"What was heads again?"
—Mercadian magistrate
cards.name: Puppet's Verdict
cards.text: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy all creatures with power 2 or less. If you lose the flip, destroy all creatures with power 3 or greater.

cards.flavor: In pursuit of the juicy fly, Squee stumbled on the hidden hangar.
cards.name: Robber Fly
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Robber Fly becomes blocked, defending player discards all the cards in his or her hand, then draws that many cards.

cards.flavor: The Kyren goblins created most of the inverted mountain's tunnels simply by driving the beast before them.
cards.name: Rock Badger
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

cards.flavor: The ground shakes when he walks. His customers shake if they're late with his fee.
cards.name: Seismic Mage
cards.text: {2}{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy target land.

cards.flavor: When goblins blow themselves up, it's called stupidity. When humans do, it's called heroism.
cards.name: Shock Troops
cards.text: Sacrifice Shock Troops: Shock Troops deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: Explosions ripped through the ship overhead, and those unfortunate enough to be directly below scrambled to find cover.
cards.name: Sizzle
cards.text: Sizzle deals 3 damage to each opponent.

cards.flavor: "General?!" Tahngarth roared. "General nuisance, maybe."
cards.name: Squee, Goblin Nabob
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return Squee, Goblin Nabob from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: The return of Ramos was foretold by devastating natural disasters and unnatural storms.
cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.

cards.flavor: Only the foolish and the rich build their houses where the land is thin and the ocean is near.
cards.name: Tectonic Break
cards.text: Each player sacrifices X lands.

cards.flavor: Bit by bit, Mercadia City had forced the Cho-Arrim from their ancestral lands. They would be pushed no further.
cards.name: Territorial Dispute
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Territorial Dispute unless you sacrifice a land.
Players can't play lands.

cards.name: Thieves' Auction
cards.text: Exile all nontoken permanents. Starting with you, each player chooses one of the exiled cards and puts it onto the battlefield tapped under his or her control. Repeat this process until all cards exiled this way have been chosen.

cards.name: Thunderclap
cards.text:
You may sacrifice a Mountain rather than pay Thunderclap's mana cost.
Thunderclap deals 3 damage to target creature.

cards.flavor: Without a word, Gerrard and Sisay ran deeper into the mountain. Neither of them intended to leave Mercadia without the Weatherlight and its crew.
cards.name: Tremor
cards.text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.

cards.name: Two-Headed Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Two-Headed Dragon can block an additional creature.
{1}{R}: Two-Headed Dragon gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Cho-Manno knew he had no choice but to ally with Gerrard. If that's what it took to free his people, he'd pay the price.
cards.name: Uphill Battle
cards.text: Creatures played by your opponents enter the battlefield tapped.

cards.flavor: The Cho-Arrim call it "the fury of Ramos."
cards.name: Volcanic Wind
cards.text: Volcanic Wind deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures, where X is the number of creatures on the battlefield as you cast Volcanic Wind.

cards.flavor: The rhythm isn't a call to arms, but a signal that the goblins have made a new enemy.
cards.name: War Cadence
cards.text: {X}{R}: This turn, creatures can't block unless their controller pays {X} for each blocking creature he or she controls.

cards.flavor: Funny how money and war travel so well together.
cards.name: Warmonger
cards.text: {2}: Warmonger deals 1 damage to each creature without flying and each player. Any player may activate this ability.

cards.flavor: Cho-Manno had never seen Mercadia City's forces fight so well. The magistrate must have hired a new hero.
cards.name: Warpath
cards.text: Warpath deals 3 damage to each blocking creature and each blocked creature.

cards.flavor: Jhovalls sharpen their claws on trees—or on Mercadians, if no trees are handy.
cards.name: Wild Jhovall
Word of Blasting
cards.text: Destroy target Wall. It can't be regenerated. Word of Blasting deals damage equal to that Wall's converted mana cost to the Wall's controller.

cards.flavor: The masks, like the ancient trees they're grown from, lend strength to the dryads.
cards.name: Ancestral Mask
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 for each other enchantment on the battlefield.

cards.name: Bifurcate
cards.text: Search your library for a permanent card with the same name as target nontoken creature and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Its eyes are bigger than its stomach, but its mouth is larger still.
cards.name: Boa Constrictor
cards.text: {T}: Boa Constrictor gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: As easily as the dryads could close a fist, so could the branches and underbrush entangle.
cards.name: Briar Patch
cards.text: Whenever a creature attacks you, it gets -1/-0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Caller of the Hunt
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Caller of the Hunt, choose a creature type.
Caller of the Hunt's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures of the chosen type on the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Even the wasp knows how to pay the magistrate his due respect.
cards.name: Caustic Wasps
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Caustic Wasps deals combat damage to a player, you may destroy target artifact that player controls.

cards.name: Clear the Land
cards.text: Each player reveals the top five cards of his or her library, puts all land cards revealed this way onto the battlefield tapped, and exiles the rest.

cards.flavor: Gerrard knew little of Ramos, the sky god they worshiped. But he felt the power of the chant.
cards.name: Collective Unconscious
cards.text: Draw a card for each creature you control.

cards.flavor: Morning's mists can hide many things.
cards.name: Dawnstrider
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.flavor: With his newfound sense of self-importance, Squee set his sights on ever-bigger bugs.
cards.name: Deadly Insect
cards.text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.flavor: His drums echo Deepwood's heartbeat.
cards.name: Deepwood Drummer
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: They'd guarded the Henge so long that they were as attuned to the powerstones as they were to the trees.
cards.name: Deepwood Elder
cards.text: {X}{G}{G}, {T}, Discard a card: X target lands become Forests until end of turn.

cards.flavor: A single tantiv is just as dangerous as a herd.
cards.name: Deepwood Tantiv
cards.text: Whenever Deepwood Tantiv becomes blocked, you gain 2 life.

cards.flavor: The jhovalls are depleting its food sources, the Mercadians are eroding its home, and you're wondering why it's angry?
cards.name: Deepwood Wolverine
cards.text: Whenever Deepwood Wolverine becomes blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The magical dust clouds Mercadian mages use to traverse the plane generate storms that devastate the surrounding terrain. But as long as the storms don't touch the mountain, the nobles simply don't care.
cards.name: Desert Twister
cards.text: Destroy target permanent.

cards.flavor: Unlike scorpions, the erithizon isn't immune to its own weaponry.
cards.name: Erithizon
cards.text: Whenever Erithizon attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature of defending player's choice.

cards.flavor:
"You lot go on ahead. I'll keep killing them until it sticks."
—Tahngarth
cards.name: Ferocity
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked, you may put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Food Chain
cards.text: Exile a creature you control: Add X mana of any one color to your mana pool, where X is the exiled creature's converted mana cost plus one. Spend this mana only to cast creature spells.

cards.name: Foster
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control dies, you may pay {1}. If you do, reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card. Put that card into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

cards.name: Game Preserve
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, each player reveals the top card of his or her library. If all cards revealed this way are creature cards, put those cards onto the battlefield under their owners' control.

cards.name: Giant Caterpillar
cards.text: {G}, Sacrifice Giant Caterpillar: Put a 1/1 green Insect creature token with flying named Butterfly onto the battlefield at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: Whereas the rebels fight to defend the land, they work to renew it.
cards.name: Groundskeeper
cards.text: {1}{G}: Return target basic land card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor:
"If I says it's a troll, it's a troll. Goblins is always right in Mercadia."
—Squee
cards.name: Horned Troll
cards.text: {G}: Regenerate Horned Troll.

cards.name: Howling Wolf
cards.text: When Howling Wolf enters the battlefield, you may search your library for up to three cards named Howling Wolf, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Just one can feed a dozen people for a month.
cards.name: Hunted Wumpus
cards.text: When Hunted Wumpus enters the battlefield, each other player may put a creature card from his or her hand onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Invigorate
cards.text:
If you control a Forest, rather than pay Invigorate's mana cost, you may have an opponent gain 3 life.
Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Land Grant
cards.text:
If you have no land cards in hand, you may reveal your hand rather than pay Land Grant's mana cost.
Search your library for a Forest card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"I can feel the strength of the entire forest."
—Gerrard
cards.name: Ley Line
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature of his or her choice.

cards.flavor:
The satyr carves the path that all of Rushwood follows.
—Cho-Arrim saying
cards.name: Lumbering Satyr
cards.text: All creatures have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.flavor: Deepwood's reach is not long, so it invites its enemies in.
cards.name: Lure
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

cards.name: Megatherium
cards.text:
Trample
When Megatherium enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you pay {1} for each card in your hand.

cards.flavor: As long as the dryads are a part of the forest, the forest is a part of the army.
cards.name: Natural Affinity
cards.text: All lands become 2/2 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.

cards.flavor: Only Rushwood is vast enough to swallow this creature whole.
cards.name: Pangosaur
cards.text: Whenever a player plays a land, return Pangosaur to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: Gerrard's heart ached, recalling the living wreath Mirri laid for her dead kin. No such memorial was left for her in Rath.
cards.name: Revive
cards.text: Return target green card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Rushwood is a living jewel that reflects its dwellers' hearts.
cards.name: Rushwood Dryad
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.name: Rushwood Elemental
cards.text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Rushwood Elemental.

cards.flavor: When generals gather their armies, healers gather their herbs.
cards.name: Rushwood Herbalist
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Regenerate target creature.

cards.name: Rushwood Legate
cards.text: If an opponent controls an Island and you control a Forest, you may cast Rushwood Legate without paying its mana cost.

cards.flavor: They stay on the battlefield only long enough to consume the losers.
cards.name: Saber Ants
cards.text: Whenever Saber Ants is dealt damage, you may put that many 1/1 green Insect creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: To see one is a good omen to the Cho-Arrim.
cards.name: Sacred Prey
cards.text: Whenever Sacred Prey becomes blocked, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Silverglade Elemental
cards.text: When Silverglade Elemental enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Silverglade Pathfinder
cards.text: {1}{G}, {T}, Discard a card: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
If the ground is smooth, the way will be rough.
—Deepwood saying
cards.name: Snake Pit
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a blue or black spell, you may put a 1/1 green Snake creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: There's little advantage to surprising the gahr.
cards.name: Snorting Gahr
cards.text: Whenever Snorting Gahr becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: It hardly weighs anything, but it takes all day to remove.
cards.name: Spidersilk Armor
cards.text: Creatures you control get +0/+1 and have reach. (They can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor: Saprolings always thrive on the ruins of others, and Mercadia ruins more than most.
cards.name: Spontaneous Generation
cards.text: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield for each card in your hand.

cards.flavor: The air that holds them aloft can just as easily put them down.
cards.name: Squall
cards.text: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.

cards.flavor: "Squall, gale, hurricane—it's all a matter of size . . . and price."
cards.name: Squallmonger
cards.text: {2}: Squallmonger deals 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player. Any player may activate this ability.

cards.name: Stamina
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has vigilance.
Sacrifice Stamina: Regenerate enchanted creature.

cards.flavor: Like the dryads, the forest itself willingly gives up some of its life for the sake of the future.
cards.name: Sustenance
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice a land: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Cho-Arrim martial artists emulate the beasts of their home.
cards.name: Tiger Claws
cards.text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has trample.

cards.flavor: Sisay had been restored to her place on the ship, the Legacy had been recovered, and the Weatherlight was sailing home to Dominaria. Gerrard focused on the debts he'd settled . . . and on those he'd soon collect.
cards.name: Tranquility
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.

cards.flavor: The dryads need neither size nor strength to defeat their enemies in battle.
cards.name: Venomous Breath
cards.text: Choose target creature. At this turn's next end of combat, destroy all creatures that blocked or were blocked by it this turn.

cards.flavor: A pretty little death is still death.
cards.name: Venomous Dragonfly
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Venomous Dragonfly blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

cards.name: Vernal Equinox
cards.text: Any player may cast creature and enchantment cards as though they had flash.

cards.name: Vine Dryad
cards.text:
Flash
Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
You may exile a green card from your hand rather than pay Vine Dryad's mana cost.

cards.flavor: "We protect our own with our own."
cards.name: Vine Trellis
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Assembly Hall
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Reveal a creature card in your hand. Search your library for a card with the same name as that card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: A steel snake with ten thousand teeth.
cards.name: Barbed Wire
cards.text:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Barbed Wire deals 1 damage to that player.
{2}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt by Barbed Wire this turn.

cards.flavor: Although it looks like a game, business around the table is deadly serious.
cards.name: Bargaining Table
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Draw a card. X is the number of cards in an opponent's hand.

cards.name: Credit Voucher
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Credit Voucher: Shuffle any number of cards from your hand into your library, then draw that many cards.

cards.flavor: Mercadian soldiers excel at finding things to stand behind.
cards.name: Crenellated Wall
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{T}: Target creature gets +0/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Crooked Scales
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy target creature an opponent controls. If you lose the flip, destroy target creature you control unless you pay {3} and repeat this process.

cards.name: Crumbling Sanctuary
cards.text: If damage would be dealt to a player, that player exiles that many cards from the top of his or her library instead.

cards.flavor: The magistrate seems to prefer a distorted perspective of reality.
cards.name: Distorting Lens
cards.text: {T}: Target permanent becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Ramos wept, and there were seas.
cards.name: Eye of Ramos
cards.text:
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
Sacrifice Eye of Ramos: Add {U} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: A uniform fit for a goblin.
cards.name: General's Regalia
cards.text: {3}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, that damage is dealt to target creature you control instead.

cards.flavor: Ramos bled, and there was fire.
cards.name: Heart of Ramos
cards.text:
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
Sacrifice Heart of Ramos: Add {R} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Like so many Thran relics, the wurm engine kept operating long after its creators were gone.
cards.name: Henge Guardian
cards.text: {2}: Henge Guardian gains trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"This horn is an exact replica of the fabled Horn of Ramos, except mine is more lavish."
—Mercadian magistrate
cards.name: Horn of Plenty
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, he or she may pay {1}. If that player does, he or she draws a card at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: Ramos touched, and there was life.
cards.name: Horn of Ramos
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
Sacrifice Horn of Ramos: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor:
"The only way to get Mercadians to fight on the front lines is to give them really long weapons."
—Gerrard
cards.name: Iron Lance
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Jeweled Torque
cards.text:
As Jeweled Torque enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Whenever a player casts a spell of the chosen color, you may pay {2}. If you do, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Kyren Archive
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile the top card of your library face down.
{5}, Discard your hand, Sacrifice Kyren Archive: Put all cards exiled with Kyren Archive into their owner's hand.

cards.name: Kyren Toy
cards.text:
{1}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Kyren Toy.
{T}, Remove X charge counters from Kyren Toy: Add {X}{1} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Magistrate's Scepter
cards.text:
{4}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Magistrate's Scepter.
{T}, Remove three charge counters from Magistrate's Scepter: Take an extra turn after this one.

cards.flavor: One may as well chart the clouds as try to map Mercadia.
cards.name: Mercadian Atlas
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, if you didn't play a land this turn, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Mercadian Lift
cards.text:
{1}, {T}: Put a winch counter on Mercadian Lift.
{T}, Remove X winch counters from Mercadian Lift: You may put a creature card with converted mana cost X from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Monkey Cage
cards.text: When a creature enters the battlefield, sacrifice Monkey Cage and put X 2/2 green Ape creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is that creature's converted mana cost.

cards.flavor: A drop numbs the tongue. A sip sends the heart racing. A draught reforges the body.
cards.name: Panacea
cards.text: {X}{X}, {T}: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.flavor: As he repaired the ship's planeswalking engine, Karn saw for the first time how he could catalyze the Weatherlight's evolution.
cards.name: Power Matrix
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains flying, first strike, and trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The puffer's flesh is the deadliest in the sea—and therefore the most useful.
cards.name: Puffer Extract
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +X/+X until end of turn. Destroy it at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: Everything comes to the waterfront eventually, on the tide or on credit.
cards.name: Rishadan Pawnshop
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Shuffle target nontoken permanent you control into its owner's library.

cards.flavor: Ramos fell, and there was night.
cards.name: Skull of Ramos
cards.text:
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
Sacrifice Skull of Ramos: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Ramos smiled, and there was day.
cards.name: Tooth of Ramos
cards.text:
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
Sacrifice Tooth of Ramos: Add {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Toymaker
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Discard a card: Target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost until end of turn. (It retains its abilities.)

cards.name: Worry Beads
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Dust Bowl
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice a land: Destroy target nonbasic land.

cards.name: Fountain of Cho
cards.text:
Fountain of Cho enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Put a storage counter on Fountain of Cho.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Fountain of Cho: Add {W} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

cards.flavor:
It is the hub. We are the wheel.
—Dryad saying
cards.name: Henge of Ramos
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Hickory Woodlot
cards.text:
Hickory Woodlot enters the battlefield tapped with two depletion counters on it.
{T}, Remove a depletion counter from Hickory Woodlot: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool. If there are no depletion counters on Hickory Woodlot, sacrifice it.

cards.flavor: If it can't be had here, it can't be had on any world.
cards.name: High Market
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain 1 life.

cards.name: Mercadian Bazaar
cards.text:
Mercadian Bazaar enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Put a storage counter on Mercadian Bazaar.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Mercadian Bazaar: Add {R} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

cards.name: Peat Bog
cards.text:
Peat Bog enters the battlefield tapped with two depletion counters on it.
{T}, Remove a depletion counter from Peat Bog: Add {B}{B} to your mana pool. If there are no depletion counters on Peat Bog, sacrifice it.

cards.name: Remote Farm
cards.text:
Remote Farm enters the battlefield tapped with two depletion counters on it.
{T}, Remove a depletion counter from Remote Farm: Add {W}{W} to your mana pool. If there are no depletion counters on Remote Farm, sacrifice it.

cards.flavor: Rishada is the gateway to free trade—but the key will cost you.
cards.name: Rishadan Port
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Tap target land.

cards.name: Rushwood Grove
cards.text:
Rushwood Grove enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Put a storage counter on Rushwood Grove.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Rushwood Grove: Add {G} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

cards.name: Sandstone Needle
cards.text:
Sandstone Needle enters the battlefield tapped with two depletion counters on it.
{T}, Remove a depletion counter from Sandstone Needle: Add {R}{R} to your mana pool. If there are no depletion counters on Sandstone Needle, sacrifice it.

cards.name: Saprazzan Cove
cards.text:
Saprazzan Cove enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Put a storage counter on Saprazzan Cove.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Saprazzan Cove: Add {U} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

cards.name: Saprazzan Skerry
cards.text:
Saprazzan Skerry enters the battlefield tapped with two depletion counters on it.
{T}, Remove a depletion counter from Saprazzan Skerry: Add {U}{U} to your mana pool. If there are no depletion counters on Saprazzan Skerry, sacrifice it.

cards.name: Subterranean Hangar
cards.text:
Subterranean Hangar enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Put a storage counter on Subterranean Hangar.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Subterranean Hangar: Add {B} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

cards.flavor: Like the city, weakest at its foundation.
cards.name: Tower of the Magistrate
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Target creature gains protection from artifacts until end of turn.
